snippet: Firefighters in Oklahoma struggled on Saturday to contain at least a dozen wildfires that have burned more than 80,000 acres near Oklahoma City.
abstract: Firefighters in Oklahoma struggle to contain at least a dozen wildfires that have burned more than 80,000 acres near Oklahoma City; fueled by searing temperatures and whipped by high winds, the fires forced hundreds of people to flee and have burned dozens of homes; Oklahoma and other Midwestern states are suffering from one of the worst droughts in recent memory.
lead_paragraph: Firefighters in Oklahoma struggled on Saturday to contain at least a dozen wildfires that have burned more than 80,000 acres near Oklahoma City.

headline.main: High Winds and Drought Fuel Oklahoma Wildfires
headline.print_headline: High Winds and Drought Fuel Oklahoma Wildfires
